macroSpec.desc: defines the range of attribute values expressing a degree of certainty
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values expressing a probability
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values used for numeric values
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values used for a non-negative integer value used as a count
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values expressing a temporal expression such as a date, a time, or a combination of them, that conform to the W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes specification.
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values available for representation of a duration in time using W3C datatypes
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values used to express a truth value
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values used to express a truth value which may be unknown
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values used to identify a particular combination of human language and writing system
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values used to identify human or animal sex
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values used to indicate XML namespaces as defined by the W3C Namespaces in XML technical recommendation
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines a range of values for use in specifying the size of an object that is intended for display on the web
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines a range of attribute values expressed as a regular expression
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values used to provide a single pointer to any other resource, either within the current document or elsewhere
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values expressing a coded value by means of an arbitrary identifier, typically taken from a set of externally-defined possibilities
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values expressed as a single word or token
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values expressing a coded value by means of a pointer to some other element which contains a definition for it.
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values expressed as an XML name or identifier
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the range of attribute values expressed as a single word or token taken from a list of documented possibilities
TO BE TRANSLATED

classSpec.desc: provides attributes for elements representing speech or action that can be ascribed to a specific individual.

attDef.desc: indicates the person, or group of people, to whom the element content is ascribed.
attDef.valDesc: For transcribed speech, this will typically identify a participant or participant group; in other contexts, it will point to any identified person element.

classSpec.desc: provides attributes describing the nature of an authorial intervention.

attDef.desc: signifies the hand of the agent which made the addition or performed the deletion.
attDef.valDesc: must refer to a hand element, typically declared in the document header (see section ).

attDef.desc: may be used to indicate faulty deletions, e.g. strikeouts which include too much or too little text, or erroneous additions, e.g., an insertion which duplicates some of the text already present.

valItem.desc: all of the text indicated as an addition duplicates some text that is in the original, whether the duplication is word-for-word or less exact.
part of the text indicated as an addition duplicates some text that is in the original
some text at the beginning of the deletion is marked as deleted even though it clearly should not be deleted.
some text at the end of the deletion is marked as deleted even though it clearly should not be deleted.
some text at the beginning of the deletion is not marked as deleted even though it clearly should be.
some text at the end of the deletion is not marked as deleted even though it clearly should be.

attDef.desc: classifies the type of addition or deletion using any convenient typology.
attDef.valDesc: a string identifying the class of addition or deletion.

classSpec.desc: provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain datable events using the W3C datatypes.

attDef.desc: specifies the earliest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.
attDef.valDesc: A normalized form of temporal expression conforming to the W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition.

attDef.desc: specifies the latest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.
attDef.valDesc: A normalized form of temporal expression conforming to the W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition.

attDef.desc: indicates the starting point of the period in standard form.
attDef.valDesc: A normalized form of temporal expression conforming to the W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition.

attDef.desc: indicates the ending point of the period in standard form.
attDef.valDesc: A normalized form of temporal expression conforming to the W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition.

classSpec.desc: provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain datable events.
attributes for recording normalized temporal expressions

attDef.desc: supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form.
attDef.valDesc: Any string representing a valid date, time, or one of a variety of combinations.

classSpec.desc: attributes for recording normalized temporal expressions
provides attributes for those elements in the TEI Header which may be independently selected by means of the specialpurpose decls attribute.

attDef.desc: indicates whether or not this element is selected by default when its parent is selected.

valItem.gloss: This element is selected if its parent is selected
This element can only be selected explicitly, unless it is the only one of its kind, in which case it is selected if its parent is selected.

classSpec.desc: provides attributes for elements which may be independently associated with a particular declarable element within the header, thus overriding the inherited default for that element.

attDef.desc: identifies one or more declarable elements within the header, which are understood to apply to the element bearing this attribute and its content.
attDef.valDesc: must identify a set of declarable elements of different types.

classSpec.desc: provides a set of attributes common to all elements which behave in the same way as divisions.

attDef.desc: specifies a name conventionally used for this level of subdivision, e.g. act, volume, book, section, canto, etc.
specifies how the content of the division is organized.

valItem.gloss: composite content: i.e. no claim is made about the sequence in which the immediate contents of this division are to be processed, or their inter-relationships.
uniform content: i.e. the immediate contents of this element are regarded as forming a logical unit, to be processed in sequence.

attDef.desc: indicates whether this division is a sample of the original source and if so, from which part.

valItem.gloss: division lacks material present at end in source.
division lacks material at start and end.
position of sampled material within original unknown.

attDef.desc: specifies whether or not the division is fragmented by some other structural element, for example a speech which is divided between two or more verse stanzas.

valItem.gloss: the division is incomplete in some respect
either the division is complete, or no claim is made as to its completeness.
the initial part of an incomplete division
a medial part of an incomplete division
the final part of an incomplete division

classSpec.desc: attributes for recording normalized temporal durations

attDef.desc: indicates the length of this element in time.

classSpec.desc: provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain datable events.
provides attributes describing the nature of a encoded scholarly intervention or interpretation of any kind.

attDef.desc: signifies the degree of certainty associated with the intervention or interpretation.
indicates the agency responsible for the intervention or interpretation, for example an editor or transcriber.
attDef.valDesc: A pointer to an element in the document header that is associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.

attDef.desc: indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the intervention or interpretation.

valItem.desc: there is internal evidence to support the intervention.
there is external evidence to support the intervention.
the intervention or interpretation has been made by the editor, cataloguer, or scholar on the basis of their expertise.

classSpec.desc: provides a set of attributes common to all elements in the TEI encoding scheme.

attDef.desc: signals an intention that white space should be preserved by applications
provides a unique identifier for the element bearing the attribute.
gives a number (or other label) for an element, which is not necessarily unique within the document.
attDef.valDesc: any string of characters; often, but not necessarily, numeric.

attDef.desc: indicates the language of the element content using the codes from RFC 3066
attDef.valDesc: The value must conform to RFC 3066 or its succesor. If the value is a private use code (i.e., starts with x-) it should, and if not it may, match the value of an ident attribute of a language element supplied in the TEI Header of the current document.

attDef.desc: indicates how the element in question was rendered or presented in the source text.
attDef.valDesc: any string of characters; if the typographic rendition of a text is to be systematically recorded, a systematic set of values for the rend attribute should be defined.

attDef.desc: provides a base URI reference with which applications can resolve relative URI references into absolute URI references.

classSpec.desc: provides attributes for elements which represent a formal analysis or interpretation.

attDef.desc: indicates who is responsible for the interpretation.
attDef.valDesc: A pointer to an element indicating the person responsible for the interpretation, typically to a respStmt in the teiHeader.

attDef.desc: indicates what kind of phenomenon is being noted in the passage.

valItem.gloss: identifies an image in the passage.
identifies a character associated with the passage.
identifies a theme in the passage.
identifies an allusion to another text.

attDef.desc: points to instances of the analysis or interpretation represented by the current element.
attDef.valDesc: One or more valid identifiers, separated by white space.

classSpec.desc: provides attributes which qualify a measurement of some kind.

attDef.desc: names the units used for the measurement.
specifies the applicability of this measurement, where more than one object is being measured.

valItem.gloss: measurement applies to most of the instances inspected.
measurement applies to only the specified range of instances.

classSpec.desc: provides attributes to represent a regularized or normalized measurement.

attDef.desc: indicates the units used for the measurement, usually using the standard symbol for the desired units.

valItem.desc: SI unit of pressure or stress

attDef.desc: specifies the number of the specified units that comprise the measurement
indicates the substance that is being measured

classSpec.desc: provides attributes common to elements which refer to named persons, places, organizations etc.

attDef.desc: provides a means of locating a full definition for the entity being named such as a database record key or a URI.
provides a means of locating the canonical form (nym) of the names associated with the object identified by means of the key attribute and named by the element bearing it.

classSpec.desc: provides attributes for describing where on the source page or object a textual element appears.

valItem.gloss: on the other side of the leaf
note appears in the apparatus at the foot of the page.
note appears at end of chapter or volume.
note appears at foot of page.
note appears as a marked paragraph in the body of the text.
note appears between lines of the text; a less precise form of either infralinear or supralinear.
addition is made in a space left in the witness by an earlier scribe.
one or more of the other values

classSpec.desc: provides attributes for elements used for arbitrary segmentation.

attDef.valDesc: For a cl may take values such as finite, nonfinite, declarative, interrogative, relative etc. For a phr or w, values such as noun, verb, preposition, etc., may be used. For an m element, values such as clitic, prefix, stem will be more appropriate. For a c element, values such as letter, punctuation, digit may be used.

attDef.desc: characterizes the function of the segment.
attDef.valDesc: For a cl, may take values such as coordinate, subject, adverbial etc. For a phr, such values as subject, predicate etc. may be more appropriate.

attDef.desc: specifies whether or not the segment is fragmented by some other structural element, for example a clause which is divided between two or more sentences.

valItem.gloss: the segment is incomplete in some respect
either the segment is complete, or no claim is made as to its completeness
the initial part of an incomplete segment
a medial part of an incomplete segment
the final part of an incomplete segment

classSpec.desc: provides attributes for elements which delimit a span of text by pointing mechanisms rather than by enclosing it.

attDef.desc: indicates the end of a span initiated by the element bearing this attribute.
attDef.valDesc: points to an element following this one in the current document.

classSpec.desc: provides attributes used to decorate rows or cells of a table.

attDef.desc: indicates the kind of information held in this cell or in each cell of this row.
indicates the number of rows occupied by this cell or row.
attDef.valDesc: A number; a value greater than one indicates that this cellm (or row) spans several rows.

attDef.desc: indicates the number of columns occupied by this cell or row.
attDef.valDesc: A number; a value greater than one indicates that this cell or row spans several columns.

classSpec.desc: provides a set of attributes common to those elements which have a duration in time, expressed either absolutely or by reference to an alignment map.

attDef.desc: indicates the location within a temporal alignment at which this element begins.
attDef.valDesc: contains the identifier of a previously defined loc element

attDef.desc: indicates the location within a temporal alignment at which this element ends.
attDef.valDesc: contains the identifier of a previously defined loc element

classSpec.desc: provides attributes used to indicate the status of a translatable portion of an ODD document.

attDef.desc: specifies the version name or number of the source from which the translated version was derived

classSpec.desc: provides generic attributes which can be used to classify or subclassify elements in any way.

attDef.desc: characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
provides a sub-categorization of the element, if needed

classSpec.desc: groups elements which contain names of individuals or corporate bodies.
groups elements used for arbitrary segmentation.
groups phrase-level elements related to highlighting that have no specific semantics
groups phrase-level elements related to highlighting.
groups elements which denote a number, a quantity, a measurement, or similar piece of text that conveys some numerical meaning
groups together elements for containing examples
groups elements containing images, formulae, and similar objects
groups phrase-level elements for simple editorial interventions that may be useful both in transcribing and in authoring
groups only those phrase-level elements for simple editorial correction and transcription that are not likely to be useful for authoring
groups phrase-level elements for simple editorial correction and transcription.
groups elements used for purposes of location and reference
groups phrase-level elements which may appear within verse only.

groups empty elements which describe the status of other elements, for example by holding groups of links or of abstract interpretations, or by providing indications of certainty etc., and which may appear at any point in a document.
groups milestone-style elements used to represent reference systems
groups elements which are interspersed with normal text, representing non-Unicode items.
groups elements which generate declarations in some markup language in ODD documents.
groups elements which reference declarations in some markup language in ODD documents.
groups elements used to encode XML constructs at the phrase level, e.g. element names, attribute names, and attribute values
groups elements for referring to specification elements
groups elements related to highlighting which can appear either within or between chunk-level elements.
groups elements containing a bibliographic description.
groups elements containing specialized stage directions defined in the additional tag set for performance texts.
groups elements which express complex feature values in feature structures.
group elements used to represent atomic feature values in feature structures.
groups all elements defined specifically for dictionaries.
groups related parts of a dictionary entry forming a coherent subdivision, for example a particular sense, homonym, etc.
groups empty elements which perform a specifically editorial function, for example by indicating the start of a span of text added, deleted, or missing in a source.
groups elements which can occur between, but not within, paragraphs and other chunks.
The class of elements which are paragraphs for the purpose of interchange.

the class of elements describing generally unchanging physical or socially-constructed characteristics of a person, for example hair-colour, ethnicity, sex... These characteristics of an individual are typically independent of their volition or action.

the class of elements describing changeable characteristics of a person which have a definite duration, for example occupation, residence, name... These characteristics of an individual are typically a consequence of their own action or that of others.

the class of elements describing specific events in a person's history, for example birth, marriage, appointment... These are not characteristics of an individual, but often cause an individual to gain such characteristics, or to enter a new state.
the class of elements concerning which assertions are made, for example as parts of a biographical element.
the class of elements used to provide information about people and their relationships.
groups elements which describe characteristics of the people referenced by a text, or participating in a language interaction.
groups elements which provide an alternative name, explanation, or description for any markup construct.
groups elements used to directly contain quotations.
groups elements which are used to indicate intellectual responsibility, for example within a bibliographic element.
groups elements which can occur only at the end of a text division; for example, a trailer.
groups elements which can occur at the start or end of any division class element.
groups elements which appear at the level of divisions within front or back matter of performance texts only.
groups elements which can occur as direct constituents of front matter, when a full title page is not given.
groups those elements which can occur as direct constituents of a title page (docTitle, docAuth, docImprint, epigraph, etc.)
The class of elements which can appear within a manuscript item description.
groups those elements (other than choice itself) which can be used in choice alternation
groups elements representing metrical components such as verse lines.
groups elements used to describe details of an audio or video recording
groups the bibliographic elements which occur inside imprints.
groups elements which may be used inside catDesc and appear multiple times
elements used to describe the setting of a linguistic interaction.
elements used to categorise a text for example in terms of its situational parameters.
elements used within an entry in a cast list, such as dramatic role or actor's name.
specialised descriptive elements constituting the physical description of a manuscript or similar written source.
groups phrase-level elements used to represent postal or e-mail addresses.

classSpec.gloss: names of people, places, or organizations, or refering strings
classSpec.desc: groups those elements which name or refer to a person, place (man-made or geographic), or organization
groups empty elements which may appear at any point within a TEI text.
groups all elements which represent feature values in feature structures.
groups common chunk- and inter-level elements.
groups elements which can appear within bibliographic citation elements.
groups component elements of temporal expressions involving dates and time.
groups elements which appear at the level of divisions within front or back matter.
elements such as names or postal codes which may appear as a part of a postal address.
groups phrase-level elements containing names, dates, numbers, measures, and similar data.
groups elements of the intermediate (inter-level) class: these elements can occur both within and and between paragraphs or other chunk-level elements.
groups those elements which can occur at the level of individual words or phrases.
groups those elements which can occur at the level of individual words or phrases, excluding elements intended for transcription.
groups elements used to represent structural divisions recursively.
groups elements used to represent a structural division which is generated rather than explicitly present in the source.

macroSpec.gloss: component for mixed or general base
macroSpec.desc: defines the set of component-level elements for use with the mixed or general base; these are elements which can appear directly within text bodies or text divisions.
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines a sequence of component-level elements (such as paragraphs or lists) which can occur directly within text divisions and in similar positions.
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the content of paragraphs and similar elements.
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines the content of prose elements that are not used for transcription of extant materials
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines a sequence of character data and phrase-level elements.
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines a sequence of character data and those phrase-level elements that are not typically used for transcribing extant documents.
TO BE TRANSLATED

defines the content model of elements such as notes or list items, which either contain a series of component-level elements or else have the same structure as a paragraph, containing a series of phrase-level and inter-level elements.
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines a sequence of character data and gaiji elements.
TO BE TRANSLATED
groups elements which occur inside fileDesc and biblFull
TO BE TRANSLATED
defines a sequence of descriptive or identifying elements which characterize a markup object.
TO BE TRANSLATED

classSpec.desc: groups those elements which form part of a place name.
attributes for recording normalized temporal durations

attDef.desc: indicates the length of this element in time.

macroSpec.desc: defines the range of attribute values available for representation of a duration in time using ISO 8601 standard formats
TO BE TRANSLATED
